008 *******************************************************************************/
009
010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
013
014import java.util.Locale;
015
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017
018/**
019 * This class represents complex numbers. All instances are immutable.
020 * Methods are mostly defined to be compatible with 
021 * org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex and (newer)
022 * org.apache.commons.numbers.complex.Complex.
023 * Arithmetic operations are generally more precise than with the
024 * Apache implementation.
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 * @version 2022/07/05
028 */
029public class Complex {
030        
031        /** Constant - real unit value (z = 1 + i 0). */
032        public static final Complex ONE = new Complex(1, 0);
033        /** Constant - complex zero value (z = 0 + i 0). */
034        public static final Complex ZERO = new Complex(0, 0);
035        /** Constant -  imaginary unit value (z = 0 + i 1). */
036        public static final Complex I = new Complex(0, 1);
037
038        /** The real part of this complex number (publicly accessible but read-only). */
039        public final double re;
040        /** The imaginary part of this complex number (publicly accessible but read-only). */
041        public final double im;
042
043        /**
044         * Constructor.
045         * @param re real part
046         * @param im imaginary part
047         */
048        public Complex(double re, double im) {
049                this.re = re;
050                this.im = im;
051        }
052
053        /**
054         * Constructor.
055         * @param z complex quantity, which is duplicated
056         */
057        public Complex(Complex z) {
058                this.re = z.re;
059                this.im = z.im;
060        }
061
062        /**
063         * Constructor. Creates a complex quantity on the unit circle with angle {@code phi}:
064         * {@code e^(i * phi) = cos(phi) + i * sin(phi)}.
065         * @param phi the angle
066         * @see #arg()
067         */
068        public Complex(double phi) {
069                this.re = Math.cos(phi);
070                this.im = Math.sin(phi);
071        }
072        
073        /**
074         * Constructor. The x/y coordinates of the specified point are used
075         * as re/im values.
076         * 
077         * @param pnt a {@link Pnt2d} instance
078         */
079        public Complex(Pnt2d pnt) {
080                this.re = pnt.getX();
081                this.im = pnt.getY();
082        }
083        
084        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
085
086        /**
087         * Returns the absolute value of this complex number, i.e.,
088         * its radius or distance from the origin.
089         * @return the absolute value
090         */
091        public double abs() {
092                return Math.sqrt(this.abs2());
093        }
094
095        /**
096         * Returns the squared absolute value of this complex number, i.e.,
097         * its squared radius or distance from the origin.
098         * @return the squared absolute value
099         */
100        public double abs2() {
101                return re * re + im * im;
102        }
103
104        /**
105         * Returns the 'argument' of this complex number, i.e.,
106         * its angle w.r.t. to the real axis. 
107         * @return the argument (in radians)
108         */
109        public double arg() {
110                return Math.atan2(im, re);
111        }
112
113        /**
114     * Returns the conjugate {@code z*} of this complex number, i.e,
115     * if {@code z = a + i b} then {@code z* = a - i b}.
116     * @return the complex conjugate
117     */
118        public Complex conjugate() {
119                return new Complex(this.re, -this.im);
120        }
121
122        /**
123         * Adds a complex quantity to this complex number and returns
124         * a new complex number.
125         * @param z complex value
126         * @return the sum of this complex number and {@code z}
127         */
128        public Complex add(Complex z) {
129                return new Complex(this.re + z.re,  this.im + z.im);
130        }
131
132        /**
133         * Rotates this complex number by angle {@code phi} and returns
134         * the resulting complex number.
135         * @param phi the angle (in radians)
136         * @return the rotated complex value
137         */
138        public Complex rotate(double phi) {
139                return this.multiply(new Complex(phi));
140        }
141
142        @Override
143    public String toString() {
144        return String.format(Locale.US, "(%.9f, %.9f)", re, im);
145    }
146        
147    /**
148     * Returns true if the real or imaginary component of this complex number
149     * is {@code NaN}.
150     * @return true if {@code NaN}, otherwise false
151     */
152        public boolean isNaN() {
153                return Double.isNaN(this.getRe()) || Double.isNaN(this.getIm());
154        }
155        
156        /**
157         * Returns the real part of this complex number.
158         * @return the real part
159         */
160        public double getRe() {
161                return this.re;
162        }
163        
164        /**
165         * Returns the imaginary part of this complex number.
166         * @return the imaginary part
167         */
168        public double getIm() {
169                return this.im;
170        }
171
172        // -------------------------------------------------------
173        
174        /**
175         * Multiplies this complex number with another complex quantity and returns
176         * a new complex number.
177         * @param z a complex quantity
178         * @return this complex number multiplied by {@code z}
179         */
180        public Complex multiply(Complex z) {
181                // (x1 + i y1)(x2 + i y2) = (x1 x2 + y1 y2) + i (x1 y2 + y1 x2)
182                final double x = this.re * z.re - this.im * z.im;
183                final double y = this.re * z.im + this.im * z.re;
184                return new Complex(x, y);
185        }
186        
187        /**
188         * Multiplies this complex number with the scalar factor {@code s} and returns
189         * a new complex number.
190         * @param s a scalar factor
191         * @return this complex number multiplied by {@code s}
192         */
193        public Complex multiply(double s) {
194                return new Complex(this.re * s, this.im * s);
195        }
196        
197         /**
198     * Returns of value of this complex number ({@code z}) raised to the power {@code k}
199     * (integer).
200     * @param k the integer exponent (&ge; 0)
201     * @return {@code z^k}
202     */
203        public Complex pow(int k) {
204                if (k < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("exponent k >= 0 expected");
205                Complex prod = new Complex(1, 0);
206                for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
207                        prod = prod.multiply(this);
208                }
209                return prod;
210        }
211        
212        /**
213         * Returns a 2-element array with the real and imaginary part of this
214         * complex number.
215         * @return (re, im)
216         */
217        public double[] toArray() {
218                return new double[] {this.re, this.im};
219        }
220        
221
222
223        /**
224         * Checks if the given {@link Object} is equal to
225         * this {@link Complex} quantity.
226         * Calls {@link #equals(Complex, double)} if the argument is
227         * of type {@link Complex}, otherwise {@code null} is returned.
228         */
229        @Override
230        public boolean equals(Object other) {
231        if (other == this) {
232            return true;
233        }       
234        if (other instanceof Complex) {
235//              final Complex z = (Complex) other;
236//              return Double.compare(this.re, z.re) == 0 && Double.compare(this.im, z.im) == 0;
237                return this.equals((Complex) other, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
238        }
239        return false;
240        }
241        
242        /**
243         * Checks if the given {@link Complex} quantity is equal to
244         * this {@link Complex} quantity.
245         * 
246         * @param z another {@link Complex} quantity
247         * @param tolerance the maximum difference of real and imaginary parts
248         * @return true if the two complex quantities are sufficiently close, false otherwise
249         */
250        public boolean equals(Complex z, double tolerance) {
251                return isZero(this.re - z.re, tolerance) 
252                                && isZero(this.im - z.im, tolerance);
253        }
254        
255        /**
256         * Checks if the given complex quantity is equal to
257         * this {@link Complex} quantity, using the default tolerance
258         * ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
259         * 
260         * @param re real part of other complex quantity
261         * @param im imaginary part of other complex quantity
262         * @return true if the two complex quantities are sufficiently close, false otherwise
263         */
264        public boolean equals(double re, double im) {
265                //return Double.compare(this.re, re) == 0 && Double.compare(this.im, im) == 0;
266                return this.equals(re, im, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
267        }
268        
269        /**
270         * Checks if the given complex quantity is equal to
271         * this {@link Complex} quantity, using the specified tolerance.
272         * 
273         * @param re real part of other complex quantity
274         * @param im imaginary part of other complex quantity
275         * @param tolerance the maximum difference of real and imaginary parts
276         * @return true if the two complex quantities are sufficiently close, false otherwise
277         */
278        public boolean equals(double re, double im, double tolerance) {
279                return isZero(this.re - re, tolerance) 
280                                && isZero(this.im - im, tolerance);
281        }
282
283}
